title: At this point, why do any of the second tier turrets give a shield?
body: I'm sure a ton of other people agree with me here, with the fact that mid turrets had the shield removed and bot and top turrets give 30 hp, why do they even have the shield in the first place?

replies.body: Primary reason is it allows us to separate out the impact of the shields granted to champions from the shields on the towers themselves. We're interested in determining how much power, versus how much interesting gameplay, each of those grants. As a result we opted to substantially reduce one of them while leaving the other intact, thereby allowing us to better measure the effect of each.
So it's essentially testing to find out what's more satisfying for players?

Edit: Sorry folks, complete noob moment on my part, hadn't realized those were champion damage only shields...I'll have to follow up with Systems folks, get some better context here.

Less focused on satisfaction this time and more focused on power. In particular how much power's provided by a regenerating shield that makes it harder for minion waves to gradually grind down a tower versus amount of power from a shield for nearby champs.
But the shield never worked on minion waves...?

That would have created a stale position where the Inner turrets would not be susceptible to built up Minion waves. Teams wouldn't be punished for not clearing wave, and the meta would have to shift to Team fighting, because split pushing and long range wave clear would be devalued.

The turret shields does attack the siege comp however. You protect the turret from some champion damage, which means you can't easily widdle it down. And the champion shield would make it harder to be poked down while defending it.

If the current changes remain. Their will probably be more action required to actually defend turrets. But the Turrets will remain Safeish places from constant poke.
